revision.text:
{{short description|American actress, comedian and writer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Chelsea Peretti | image = Chelsea Peretti at Meltdown.jpg | caption = Peretti performing in January 2013 | birth_name = Chelsea Vanessa Peretti | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|2|20}} | birth_place = [[Contra Costa County, California]], U.S. | medium = Television, stand-up, film | active = | genre = | subject = | influenced = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Jordan Peele]]|2016}} | children = 1 | relatives = [[Jonah Peretti]] (brother) | website = {{URL|chelseaperetti.com}} }} '''Chelsea Vanessa Peretti''' (born February 20, 1978) is an American comedian, actress and writer. She portrays Gina Linetti in the police comedy series ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]''.{{cite web| url=http://www.ucbtheatre.com/talent/view/11682 |title= Chelsea Peretti Bio |publisher= Upright Citizen's Brigade Theatre |accessdate= November 14, 2013}} ==Early life== Peretti was born on February 20, 1978 in [[Contra Costa County, California]]. Her mother is Jewish and her father is of [[English people|English]] and Italian descent.{{cite web|url=http://business.highbeam.com/152499/article-1G1-167309418/interview-chelsea-and-jonah-peretti-discuss-their-controversial |title=Interview: Chelsea and Jonah Peretti discuss their controversial Web site, blackpeopleloveus.com.(9:00-10:00 AM) (Broadcast transcript) | HighBeam Business: Arrive Prepared |publisher=Business.highbeam.com |date=November 21, 2002 |accessdate=February 10, 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://contagiousmedia.org/press/bplu/bplu-nyt.htm |title=Black-White Harmony: Are You Kidding Me? |publisher=Contagiousmedia.org |date=November 17, 2002 |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040402155950/http://www.contagiousmedia.org/press/bplu/bplu-nyt.htm |archivedate=April 2, 2004 }} Peretti was raised in [[Oakland, California]].{{cite web|url=http://www.observer.com/2007/move-over-sarah-silverman|title=Move Over, Sarah Silverman!|date=July 10, 2007|work=[[New York Observer]]|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070713020148/http://observer.com/2007/move-over-sarah-silverman|archivedate=July 13, 2007}} She has two brothers and a sister; her older brother, internet entrepreneur [[Jonah Peretti]], co-founded [[BuzzFeed]] and ''[[HuffPost|The Huffington Post]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.theatlanticwire.com/politics/2012/06/jonah-perretti-what-i-read/53467/ |title= Jonah Peretti: What I Read|publisher=Theatlanticwire.com |date= June 13, 2012|accessdate=February 10, 2014}}[http://mmagazine.tumblr.com/post/45911798703/the-jolly-abrupt-wtf-rise-of-buzzfeed M Magazine: "The Jolly, Abrupt, WTF Rise of BuzzFeed" by Matthew Lynch] Peretti attended [[The College Preparatory School]] in Oakland. She moved to [[New York City]] in 1996 to attend [[Barnard College]]{{cite web |url= http://www.gothamist.com/archives/2004/02/23/chelsea_peretti_comedian.php |title= Chelsea Peretti, Comedian |publisher= ''[[Gothamist]]'' |date= February 23, 2004 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20051101064139/http://www.gothamist.com/archives/2004/02/23/chelsea_peretti_comedian.php |archivedate= November 1, 2005 |df= mdy-all }} of which she took a study year abroad in her Junior Year to [[Royal Holloway, University of London|Royal Holloway University]]{{Cite news|url=https://twitter.com/chelseaperetti/status/1003411838606901248?lang=en|title=Chelsea Peretti on Twitter|work=Twitter|access-date=August 17, 2018|language=en}}, finally graduating in 2000.{{cite web|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118021686|title=10 Comics to Watch: Chelsea Peretti|author=Dennis Hensley|date=July 13, 2010|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.barnard.edu/newscenter/archive/fall2007.html |title=Barnard College News Center |publisher=Barnard College |date=Summer 2007 |quote=Comedian Chelsea Peretti '00 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101213214951/http://barnard.edu/newscenter/archive/fall2007.html |archivedate=December 13, 2010 }}{{cite web|url=http://heebmagazine.com/chelsea-peretti-interview/31955 |title=Chelsea Peretti Talks TV, Twitter and What She Wants in a Boyfriend | Heeb |publisher=Heebmagazine.com |date= |accessdate=January 3, 2012}} She attended elementary school with her ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]'' co-star [[Andy Samberg]] and junior high school with comedian [[Moshe Kasher]].''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'', September 25, 2014 ==Career== === Writing === Peretti has written for ''[[The Village Voice]]'', ''[[Details (magazine)|Details]]'', ''[[Playgirl]]'', ''Jest'', ''[[American Theatre magazine|American Theatre Magazine]]'', as well as online publications including ''[[The Huffington Post]]''. === Television === After moving to [[Los Angeles]], Peretti made appearances on programs such as ''[[Louie (U.S. TV series)|Louie]]'', ''[[The Sarah Silverman Program]]'', ''[[TruTV Presents: World's Dumbest...]]'', and ''[[Tosh.0]]''. She appeared as a guest correspondent on one episode of ''[[Lopez Tonight]] ''interviewing local citizens about [[California Proposition 8 (2008)|Prop 8]].{{cite web |url= http://www.earwolf.com/episode/grown-up-laughs |title= Grown-Up Laughs on Who Charted |work= [[Earwolf]] |date= August 15, 2012}} Peretti is credited as a writer on six episodes of the television show ''[[Parks and Recreation]]'' from 2011 to 2012.{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2014/01/10-parks-and-rec-writers-who-have-played-characters-on-the-show/|title=10 ‘Parks and Rec’ Writers Who Have Played Characters on the Show|date=January 9, 2014|work=Splitsider|access-date=April 23, 2018|language=en-US}} Since 2013, Peretti has been a series regular on Fox's detective/police comedy ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]'', playing Gina Linetti.{{Cite news|url=http://splitsider.com/2013/09/talking-to-chelsea-peretti-about-brooklyn-nine-nine-parks-and-recreation-and-the-differences-between-new-york-and-la-standup/|title=Talking to Chelsea Peretti About ‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’, ‘Parks and Rec’, and the Differences Between NY and LA Standup|date=September 30, 2013|work=Splitsider|access-date=April 23, 2018|language=en-US}} === In other media === While in New York, Peretti made short films with Variety SHAC, a comedy troupe she formed in 2004 with [[Andrea Rosen]], [[Heather Lawless]], and [[Shonali Bhowmik]]. She has made several guest appearances on podcasts including ''[[Doug Loves Movies]]'', ''[[How Did This Get Made?]]'', ''[[You Made It Weird with Pete Holmes]]'', ''[[The Todd Glass Show]]'', ''The Lavender Hour'', ''The Bone Zone'' ''with'' ''[[Brendon Walsh]]'' ''and'' ''Randy Liedtke'', and ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!|Comedy Bang! Bang]]!'' In October 2012, Peretti launched her own call-in podcast, ''Call Chelsea Peretti''.{{cite web |url=http://www.feralaudio.com/show/call-chelsea-peretti/ | title= Call Chelsea Peretti |publisher= Feral Audio|accessdate=February 10, 2014}} In July 2010, Peretti made ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' magazine's "Ten Comics to Watch in 2010" list. ''[[Paste (magazine)|Paste]]'' ranked her [[Twitter]] account #75 on "The 75 Best Twitter Accounts of 2014".{{cite news|first1=Hudson |last1=Hongo|url=http://www.pastemagazine.com/blogs/lists/2014/12/the-75-best-twitter-accounts-of-2014.html|title=The 75 Best Twitter Accounts of 2014 :: Comedy :: Lists :: Paste|work=[[Paste (magazine)|Paste]]|date=December 15, 2014|accessdate=December 27, 2014}} ==Personal life== Peretti began dating actor, comedian and filmmaker [[Jordan Peele]] in March 2013.{{cite web |url=http://dishnation.com/andy-samberg-played-cupid-for-funnyman-jordan-peele-and-his-childhood-friend-and-brooklyn-nine-nine-co-star-chelsea-peretti/|title= Andy Samberg's Latest Role Is Playing Cupid!|publisher=dishnation.com |date= September 2, 2014|accessdate=November 24, 2014}} They were introduced by mutual friend Andy Samberg and became engaged in November 2015.[http://www.people.com/article/jordan-peele-chelsea-peretti-engaged People: "Jordan Peele and Chelsea Peretti Announce Engagement on Twitter" BY CHAR ADAMS] November 29, 2015 On April 26, 2016, Peretti announced on [[Instagram]] that she and Peele had "[[Elopement (marriage)|eloped]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/article/chelsea-peretti-jordan-peele-elope-twitter |title=Surprise! Chelsea Peretti and Jordan Peele Eloped |publisher=People.com |date=April 26, 2016 |accessdate=April 26, 2016 }} They have a son named Beaumont Gino Peele (born July 1, 2017).{{cite web |url=http://www.eonline.com/news/864098/jordan-peele-and-chelsea-peretti-welcome-their-first-child |title=Jordan Peele and Chelsea Peretti Welcome Their First Child |publisher=[[E! News]] |author1=Schiff, Matthew |author2=Passalaqua, Holly |date=July 17, 2017 |accessdate=July 18, 2017}} ==Filmography== ===Films=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year !! Title !! Role !! Notes |- | 2007 || ''[[Twisted Fortune]]'' || Rachel || |- | 2011 || ''Guy Talk'' || Girl || |- | 2014 || ''Women Aren't Funny'' || Herself || |- | 2016 || ''[[Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping]]'' || Brunette CMZ Reporter || |- | 2018 || ''[[Game Night (film)|Game Night]]'' || Glenda || |- | TBA || ''[[Spinster (film)|Spinster]]'' || Gaby ||Filming |- | TBA || ''[[Friendsgiving (film)|Friendsgiving]]'' || Claire || Post-production |} ===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
